questions.question: She puts ...................... a small amount every month towards her retirement.
questions.description: To put something by is to save an amount of money to use later.

questions.question: The meeting has been put ...................... until Thursday.
questions.description: To put off is to postpone.

questions.question: He is just putting ...................... an act to win your sympathy.
questions.description: To put on an act is to fake and pretend.

questions.question: I cannot put ............................... this heat.
questions.description: To put up with something is to tolerate it.

questions.question: The firemen worked hard to put .......................... the fire.
questions.description: To put out fire is to extinguish it.

questions.question: Could you put me ............................. to the manager?
questions.description: To put x through to y is to connect x and y.

questions.question: Don't forget to put the lights ........................ when you leave.
questions.description: To put lights out is to switch them off.

questions.question: I am sorry to have to put you ....................... this.
questions.description: To put somebody through something is to cause them to experience something.

questions.question: You need good communication skills to be able to put your message ......................
questions.description: To put your message across is to communicate it.

questions.question: My professor has agreed to put a good word .................... for me.
questions.description: To put a word in for somebody is to recommend them.

questions.question: You had better put your coat ....................... before going out. It is very cold outside.
questions.description: To put on clothes is to wear them.

questions.question: Everybody liked the suggestion put ........................... by Susie.
questions.description: To put forward a suggestion is to present it for other people's consideration.
